creator: cloornihir@kriocoucke.mailexpire.com
text:
When compiling httpd-2.2.0 without e2fsprogs libraries present, the libuuid 
libraries are missing, causing the following error message during the 
configure process:

configure: error: ... SSL/TLS libraries were missing or unusable

However, the SSL/TLS libraries are in fact present, which makes the error 
confusing. From config.log:

configure:13598: checking for SSLeay_version in -lcrypto
configure:13628: gcc -o conftest -O2 -pthread  -DLINUX=2 -D_REENTRANT -
D_GNU_SOURCE -D_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE   conftest.c -lcrypto   -lm  -luuid -lrt -
lcrypt  -lpthread -ldl >&5
/usr/lib/gcc-lib/i486-slackware-linux/3.3.4/../../../../i486-slackware-
linux/bin/ld: cannot find -luuid
collect2: ld returned 1 exit status
configure:13634: $? = 1
configure: failed program was:
| /* confdefs.h.  */


Perhaps an earlier check for the libuuid dependencies would solve the problem?

So, you have the uuid.h installed (normally part of e2fsprogs too), but the
library isn't installed?
creator: chip@force-elite.com
wrowe@apache.org
text:
In this case -luuid was picked up from openssl.pc by the builder who had
  packaged your openssl, yet they failed to mention uuid was a required
  dependency.  Rather odd, actually, but afraid this is a local machine issue,
  and not even an apr issue, but an httpd issue.  Given the disposition, I won't
  bother to reclassify.
